question: Does RANKL–RANK signaling promote the development of Aire-expressing medullary thymic epithelial cells (mTECs) in the thymus? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Here we show that the cytokine RANK ligand (RANKL) was produced by positively selected thymocytes and regulated the cellularity of mTEC by interacting with RANK and osteoprotegerin.
content.source_2: Whereas only CD40 signaling was essential for mTEC development during embryogenesis, cooperation with RANK was not required postnatally, and genetic or pharmacologic disruption of RANK failed to affect Aire+ mTEC differentiation.
content.source_3: We show that RANKL signals from this cell promote the maturation of RANK-expressing CD80−Aire− mTEC progenitors into CD80+Aire+ mTECs, and that transplantation of RANK-deficient thymic stroma into immunodeficient hosts induces autoimmunity.
content.source_4: In contrast to models positing Rankl(+) lymphoid tissue inducer cells and invariant Vγ5(+) DETC progenitors as drivers, the emergence of the first cohorts of Aire(+) mTECs prior to αβ T cell repertoire selection proceeded normally in mice lacking Rankl expression and in DETC-deficient thymi.
